subSubSection.paragraph: BOLD:AAI9864. Consensus barcode. . Both sexes have a strongly bent forewing vein M+Cu1 and comparatively short hind tibial spurs; the females have a robust and yellowish hind tarsus, which is ivory or whitish and slenderer in males.
♂, Alajuela, Sector Rincon Rain Forest, Camino Albergue Oscar, 10.877 , -85.324 , 560 meters, caterpillar collection date 3/iii/2008, wasp eclosion date 26/v/2008.

Host data .
Turuptiana obliqua
( Erebidae ) feeding on
Nectandra hihua
( Lauraceae ).

Caterpillar and figured male voucher codes .
DHJPAR0027736.

Host =
Hypocrisias
Espinoza01 DHJPAR0027736, DHJPAR0029351, DHJPAR0029352, DHJPAR0029353, DHJPAR0029355. Depository: CNC.
The species is widespread from British Columbia, Canada, through the western USA, Mexico, and Meso America. One specimen from British Columbia (BIOUG22381-E09) is in the same BIN.
